enabledTestModal.title: Enable or Disable API Testing
enabledTestModal.hint: Enable or disable the corresponding test types for all APIs under the service.

parameterizationDataset.title: Dataset
parameterizationDataset.description: Import predefined datasets that can be used as parameters in the current request. Note: Dataset parameters only take effect after being referenced. When dataset parameter names conflict with variable names, dataset parameter values have higher priority than variable values.
parameterizationDataset.recycleTooltip: After all data rows in the dataset have been used, data will be reused from the beginning.
parameterizationDataset.stopThreadTooltip: After all data rows in the dataset have been used, stop the current sampling thread execution. When all threads have read all rows, the entire execution exits and ends.
parameterizationDataset.allThreadTooltip: All threads share the same dataset data.
parameterizationDataset.currentThreadTooltip: Each thread copies its own dataset data.
parameterizationDataset.noDataMessage: You have not referenced any datasets yet
parameterizationDataset.cancelReferenceConfirm: Are you sure you want to cancel referencing dataset 「{name}」?
parameterizationDataset.fileHint: Read datasets from files. Each dataset can create up to 200 parameters, each parameter file cannot exceed 500MB, and the total number of rows cannot exceed 1 million.
parameterizationDataset.jdbcHint: Extract a value from the database query results as the dataset value before each test execution.

previewData.hintText: Each time, at most 10,000 data can be previewed, and the actual parameter values of the Mock function are generated during sampling.

useList.hintText: View the resource information used by the variable.

staticParameter.hintText: Generate parameter values dynamically during sampling, each dataset can create up to 200 parameters, and the maximum number of rows supported is 100 billion.

parameterizationVariable.title: Variables
parameterizationVariable.hints: Import predefined variables that can be used as parameters in the current request. Note: Variables only take effect after being referenced.
parameterizationVariable.noDataMessage: You have not referenced any variables yet
parameterizationVariable.cancelReferenceConfirm: Are you sure you want to cancel referencing variable 「{name}」?

moduleTreeSelector.title: Cases
moduleTreeSelector.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete module 「{name}」?

delScriptModal.title: Delete Test Script
delScriptModal.selectScriptType: Please select the script type to delete

genTestScriptModal.title: Generate Test Script
genTestScriptModal.note: Note: If a test script of the corresponding type already exists, it will be automatically ignored. If you need to regenerate a new test script based on current interface parameters, please delete the corresponding test type script first.
genTestScriptModal.noteHighlight: Only one script of each test type is allowed per interface.
genTestScriptModal.generateSuccess: Test script generated successfully, please check details in 'Scripts'
genTestScriptModal.updateSuccess: Test script updated successfully, please check details in 'Scripts'

testForm.rampUpTooltip: Used to increase concurrent threads during testing to increase system pressure. Through gradual pressure increase, you can observe system performance and stability under different pressures.
testForm.ignoreAssertionsTooltip: If not ignored, assertion failures will be treated as sampling errors.
testForm.updateTestResultTooltip: Whether to update test results to associated resources (API, test cases, or scenarios).
testForm.authControlTooltip: Whether the generated script is subject to permission control. When under permission control, only the creator is visible by default and has full permissions. Other users need to manually authorize through 'Scripts' -> 'Authorization'. When not under permission control, all users are visible and can operate.

shareModal.title: Share Management

tooltip.privateShareDesc: Private share, requires password to access

shareModal.expiredTimeTip: Expiration time is less than 24 hours, please select a new date

delTaskTestModal.title: Delete Test Task
delTaskTestModal.confirmMessage: This operation will permanently delete the task. Are you sure you want to continue?

xcan_apiAssert.executionConditionExpressionDesc: Used to control whether this assertion is executed. When the condition expression is satisfied or the condition expression is empty, the assertion will be executed.
xcan_apiAssert.variableDescription: "Variable" is a variable defined in the current interface or parent project/service or global, where the variable reference symbol {} can be omitted.
xcan_apiAssert.valueDescription: The "value" on the right side of the operator can only be a constant.
xcan_apiAssert.expectedValueDesc: When the assertion condition is "regex match", "XPath match", or "JSONPath match", the expected value is optional.
xcan_apiAssert.expectedValueEmptyDesc: When the expression matches a value, the assertion passes, otherwise it fails.
xcan_apiAssert.expectedValueNotEmptyDesc: When the expression match value equals the expected value, the assertion passes, otherwise it fails.
xcan_apiAssert.matchItemDesc: When the expression matches multiple values or the result is an array, specify which value to use as the expression expected value. Supports positions from 0 to maximum 2000. Returns null when the specified position data does not exist. Merges multiple values into one value when not specified.
xcan_apiAssert.regexExample: When position is not specified, the default is to take the merged result merged match value: "1888888888813999999999", specify position 0 to get value: "18888888888", specify position 1 to get value: "13999999999".
xcan_apiAssert.jsonpathExample: When position is not specified, the default is to take the merged result: 「{"title":"Sayings of the Century","price":100},{"title":"confucianism","price":200}」, specify position 0 to get value: {"title":"Sayings of the Century","price":100}, specify position 1 to get value: {"title":"confucianism","price":200}.
xcan_apiAssert.xpathExample: When position is not specified, the default is to take the merged result: "30codingbasketballAngus132codingAngus2", specify position 0 to get value: "30codingbasketballAngus1", specify position 1 to get value: "32codingAngus2".
xcan_apiAssert.extractionLocationMissing: Extraction location missing, unable to extract
xcan_apiAssert.extractionLocationMissingWithDefault: Extraction location missing, unable to extract, set default value
xcan_apiAssert.extractionMethodMissing: Extraction method missing, unable to extract
xcan_apiAssert.extractionMethodMissingWithDefault: Extraction method missing, unable to extract, set default value
xcan_apiAssert.extractionParameterNameMissing: Extraction parameter name missing, unable to extract
xcan_apiAssert.extractionParameterNameMissingWithDefaul: Extraction parameter name missing, unable to extract, set default value
xcan_apiAssert.formParameterEmpty: Form parameter is empty, unable to extract
xcan_apiAssert.formParameterEmptyWithDefault: Form parameter is empty, unable to extract, set default value
xcan_apiAssert.formParameterMissing: Form parameter missing {parameterName}, unable to extract
xcan_apiAssert.formParameterMissingWithDefault: Form parameter missing {parameterName}, unable to extract, set default value
xcan_apiAssert.pathParameterEmpty: Path parameter is empty, unable to extract
xcan_apiAssert.pathParameterEmptyWithDefault: Path parameter is empty, unable to extract, set default value
xcan_apiAssert.pathParameterMissing: Path parameter missing {parameterName}, unable to extract
xcan_apiAssert.pathParameterMissingWithDefault: Path parameter missing {parameterName}, unable to extract, set default value
xcan_apiAssert.queryParameterEmpty: Query parameter is empty, unable to extract
xcan_apiAssert.queryParameterEmptyWithDefault: Query parameter is empty, unable to extract, set default value
xcan_apiAssert.queryParameterMissing: Query parameter missing {parameterName}, unable to extract
xcan_apiAssert.queryParameterMissingWithDefault: Query parameter missing {parameterName}, unable to extract, set default value
xcan_apiAssert.requestHeaderEmpty: Request header is empty, unable to extract
xcan_apiAssert.requestHeaderEmptyWithDefault: Request header is empty, unable to extract, set default value
xcan_apiAssert.requestHeaderMissing: Request header missing {parameterName}, unable to extract
xcan_apiAssert.requestHeaderMissingWithDefault: Request header missing {parameterName}, unable to extract, set default value
xcan_apiAssert.responseBodyEmpty: Response body is empty, unable to extract
xcan_apiAssert.responseBodyEmptyWithDefault: Response body is empty, unable to extract, set default value
xcan_apiAssert.responseHeaderEmpty: Response header is empty, unable to extract
xcan_apiAssert.responseHeaderEmptyWithDefault: Response header is empty, unable to extract, set default value
xcan_apiAssert.responseHeaderMissing: Response header missing {parameterName}, unable to extract
xcan_apiAssert.responseHeaderMissingWithDefault: Response header missing {parameterName}, unable to extract, set default value
xcan_apiAssert.rawRequestBodyEmpty: Raw request body is empty, unable to extract
xcan_apiAssert.rawRequestBodyEmptyWithDefault: Raw request body is empty, unable to extract, set default value

utils.extractionExpressionMissing: Extraction expression missing, unable to extract
utils.extractionExpressionMissingWithDefault: Extraction expression missing, unable to extract, set default value
utils.extractedValueEmptyWithDefault: Extracted expected value is empty, set default value
utils.regexExpressionError: Regex expression error, unable to extract
utils.regexExpressionErrorWithDefault: Regex expression error, unable to extract, set default value
utils.xpathExpressionError: XPath expression error, unable to extract
utils.xpathExpressionErrorWithDefault: XPath expression error, unable to extract, set default value
utils.jsonpathExpressionError: JSONPath expression error, unable to extract
utils.jsonpathExpressionErrorWithDefault: JSONPath expression error, unable to extract, set default value
utils.extractVariableDescription: Extract variables, if the variable rule is not satisfied, return the input value. The variable format is ${variable name}
utils.splitStringDescription: Split the string into 「left operand, operator, right operand」 according to the specified operator
utils.invalidInputString: Invalid input string, contains multiple operators or no operator or left variable and right value contain the specified operator
utils.looseEqualityDescription: No strict equality, for example: '1' == 1 results in true, 'true'==true results in true, 'false'==false results in true
utils.operatorNotInSet: Not in operator set, no operation performed
utils.basicDataTypeOnly: Only basic data type operations are supported. typeof null === 'object'
utils.typeInconsistency: Data type inconsistency, automatic type conversion, only string can be converted to other types
utils.numericOperatorRequirement: The data type of '>=', '<=', '>', '<' operators must be numeric
utils.enabledAssertionsOnly: Only enabled assertions will be executed
utils.expressionEmpty: Expression is empty, execute this assertion
utils.expressionFormatError: Expression format error, only supports operators 「"=", "!=", ">=", "<=", ">", "<"」
utils.expressionFormatErrorExtract: Expression format error, unable to extract variable name
utils.expressionFormatErrorIgnore: Expression format error, ignore this assertion
utils.variableNotDefined: Variable is not defined, the variable value is processed as variable name
utils.operationResultSuccess: Operation result is valid, execute this assertion
utils.operationResultFailure: Operation result is invalid, ignore this assertion
utils.xpathExpressionMustBeString: XPath expression must be string type
utils.regexExpressionMustBeString: Regex expression must be string type
utils.jsonpathExpressionMustBeString: JSONPath expression must be string type
utils.responseHeaderNameNotExist: Response header name does not exist

xcan_apiAuthencation.proxyNotConnected: Proxy not connected, please check proxy configuration

xcan_apiBody.totalFileSizeExceeded: Total upload file size cannot exceed {size}
xcan_apiBody.requestBodyFileSizeExceeded: Request body total upload file size cannot exceed 20MB
xcan_apiBody.enterParameterValue: Please enter parameter value, maximum 4096 characters allowed

xcan_apiCookie.nameNotMeetVariableRequirements: Name does not meet variable requirements, only allows numbers, letters, !@$%^&*()_-+=./ etc.

xcan_apiParameter.nameNotMeetVariableRequirements: Name does not meet variable requirements, only allows numbers, letters, !@$%^&*()_-+=./ etc.

xcan_apiHeader.nameNotMeetVariableRequirements: Name does not meet variable requirements, only allows numbers, letters, !@$%^&*()_-+=./ etc.

xcan_apiSetting.parameterFormatValidationDesc: When enabled, parameters will be validated first, and requests will only be sent after parameter validation passes. Default is disabled.
xcan_apiSetting.allowModifyReferencedDataModelDesc1: When enabled, modifying referenced models ($ref) will synchronously modify the referenced model template.
xcan_apiSetting.allowModifyReferencedDataModelDesc2: If the referenced model template is used by other interfaces, other interfaces will also be indirectly modified;
xcan_apiSetting.allowModifyReferencedDataModelDesc3: When disabled, modifying data models will generate copies and remove the reference relationship with the original data model, which will cause redundancy in generated OpenAPI documents and code.
xcan_apiSetting.allowModifyReferencedDataModelDesc4: Default is disabled. Note: Changes will not take effect without clicking 'Save'.
xcan_apiSetting.connectionTimeoutDesc: Specifies the maximum wait time for establishing a connection between client and server. 0 means never timeout, default is 6 seconds.
xcan_apiSetting.readTimeoutDesc: Specifies the maximum wait time for the client to receive server connection closure after establishing a connection. 0 means never timeout, default is 60 seconds.
xcan_apiSetting.retryCountOnFailureDesc: Number of retries when request fails. Default is no retry, maximum 6 retries allowed.
xcan_apiSetting.retryIntervalDesc: Retry interval when request fails. Default 200 milliseconds, maximum 30 minutes allowed.
xcan_apiSetting.maxRedirectsDesc: Number of redirects when request returns 3xx status code. Default 1 time, maximum 10 times allowed.

xcan_browserTab.tooManyTabs: Too many tabs opened, maximum {maxLength} tabs allowed.
xcan_browserTab.closeRightTabs: Close All Tabs to the Right

xcan_configProvider.websiteUpdated: The website has been updated. Please click refresh to experience the latest content. Before refreshing, we recommend saving your personal data to avoid loss. Thank you for your understanding and support!

xcan_exec.defineExtractVariableTip: Define/Extract variable interface does not support dependency on other variables.
xcan_exec.variableValuePlaceholder: Enter variable value, support Mock function, maximum 4096 characters
xcan_exec.maxThreadsTooltip: Max threads, when multiple nodes are configured, the threads will be evenly distributed to each node. Note: Mock data tasks support a maximum of 1000 threads; functional tests only allow setting one thread.
xcan_exec.iterationsTooltip: Performance, stability, and custom type test sampling iterations support a maximum of 100000000000 times; experience test supports a maximum of 1000000 times; functional test defaults to 1 time, with a maximum limit of 200 times.
xcan_exec.executionDurationTooltip: Execution duration, when iterations and duration are not configured, the default is 30 seconds, and the maximum duration is not more than 1 day.
xcan_exec.rampUpTooltip: Ramp up interval: adjust the thread startup interval, the value cannot exceed the execution duration. Ramp up threads: adjust the number of threads gradually increasing, the value cannot exceed the maximum number of threads.
xcan_exec.rampDownTooltip: Ramp down interval: adjust the thread gradually decreasing interval, the value cannot exceed the execution duration. Ramp down threads: adjust the number of threads gradually decreasing, the value cannot exceed the maximum number of threads.
xcan_exec.rampUpIntervalTooltip: Adjust the thread startup interval, the value cannot exceed the execution duration.
xcan_exec.rampUpThreadsTooltip: Adjust the number of threads gradually increasing, the value cannot exceed the maximum number of threads.
xcan_exec.rampDownIntervalTooltip: Adjust the thread gradually decreasing interval, the value cannot exceed the execution duration.
xcan_exec.rampDownThreadsTooltip: Adjust the number of threads gradually decreasing, the value cannot exceed the maximum number of threads.
xcan_exec.resetAfterRampTooltip: After adjusting the number of threads, whether to clear the previous sampling data and re-measure the sampling.
xcan_exec.startModeTooltip: Support IMMEDIATELY(Immediately) and TIMING(Timing) two ways, default value IMMEDIATELY.
xcan_exec.scheduledExecutionTimeTooltip: When the start mode is "Timing", it must be formatted: yyyy-MM-dd HH:MM:SS.
xcan_exec.priorityTooltip: Task priority, the higher the value, the higher the priority. Support range: 1-2147483647, default value 1000.
xcan_exec.executionNodeCountTooltip: The number of nodes required for task execution, default value 1. Support range: 1~200.
xcan_exec.availableExecutionNodesTooltip: Available execution node ID range, after setting, the number of nodes will be selected from the range, when the available execution node range is not specified, the number of nodes will be selected from all nodes with the "execution" role.
xcan_exec.applicationNodesTooltip: The node ID where the test application or middleware is located. Used to provide data support for application or middleware performance evaluation, fault diagnosis, capacity planning, and performance optimization.
xcan_exec.nodeSelectionStrategyTooltip: Whether to enable node automatic selection strategy, after enabling, the scheduler will select nodes that meet the following conditions to execute tasks, default is not enabled.
xcan_exec.maxTasksPerNodeTooltip: The maximum number of tasks allowed for the execution node, if it exceeds, it will be ignored, maximum 1000.
xcan_exec.lastExecutedNodeTooltip: The last executed node, select the node that last executed the current script, ignore matching when the first execution.
xcan_exec.enableIdleRateSelectionTooltip: Enable idle rate selection. Idle rate supports formats: 80%, 80, 80.88%.
xcan_exec.errorHandlingMethodTooltip: Error handling method, support CONTINUE(Continue execution, default), STOP(Stop) and STOP_NOW(Immediately stop) three ways.
xcan_exec.sampleErrorContentTooltip: Whether to sample error content, if enabled, the error will be sent to the server, default is enabled.
xcan_exec.sampleErrorContentCountTooltip: The number of sampled error content, default 20.
xcan_exec.samplingIntervalTooltip: The interval for reporting sampling results, default 5 seconds. Support range: 1~300 seconds.
xcan_exec.languageTooltip: The language displayed when outputting results and prompts, currently only supports zh_CN(Simplified Chinese) and en(English), default value zh_CN.
xcan_exec.executorTooltip: The timeout for the proxy to start the executor, default 1 minute. Support range: 1~7200 seconds.
xcan_exec.samplingInitializationTimeoutTooltip: The timeout for the Runner program to initialize sampling, default 1 minute. Support range: 1~7200 seconds.
xcan_exec.stopExecutionTimeoutTooltip: The timeout for stopping execution, if the sampling does not end after the specified timeout, the execution will be forcibly killed, which may cause sampling errors, default 3 seconds. Support range: 1~7200 seconds.
xcan_exec.ignoreAssertionsTooltip: Whether to ignore assertions, if not ignored, the sampling error will be processed when the assertion fails.
xcan_exec.updateTestResultsTooltip: Whether to update the test results to the associated resource (API, case or scenario).
xcan_exec.connectionTimeoutTooltip: Specifies the maximum wait time for establishing a connection between client and server, default 3 seconds.
xcan_exec.readTimeoutTooltip: Specifies the maximum wait time for the client to receive server connection closure after establishing a connection, default 60 seconds.
xcan_exec.retryCountOnFailureTooltip: The number of retries when the request fails. Default is no retry, maximum 6 retries allowed.
xcan_exec.maxRedirectsTooltip: The number of redirects when the request returns 3xx status code. Default 1 time, maximum 10 times allowed.
xcan_exec.responseTimeoutTooltip: Specifies the maximum wait time for the client to receive the response message, default 60 seconds.
xcan_exec.maxReconnectionsTooltip: The number of reconnection times when the connection is interrupted, default is not reconnected, maximum 100 times.
xcan_exec.reconnectionIntervalTooltip: The retry interval when the request fails, default 200 milliseconds, maximum 30 minutes allowed.
xcan_exec.databaseTypeTooltip: Supported database types: H2, HSQLDB, SQLITE, POSTGRES, MARIADB, MYSQL, ORACLE, SQLSERVER, DB2.
xcan_exec.databaseDriverClassNameTooltip: Database driver class name, such as: com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver.
xcan_exec.databaseConnectionURLTooltip: Database connection URL, such as: jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/mydatabase.
xcan_exec.transactionIsolationLevelTooltip: Transaction isolation levels: TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED(Read Uncommitted), TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED(Read Committed), TRANSACTION_REPEATABLE_READ(Repeatable Read), TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE(Serializable).
xcan_exec.connectionPoolTypeTooltip: Supported connection pools: hikari, tomcat, dbcp, dbcp2, c3p0, vibur, druid, druid_stat, druid_stat_merge.
xcan_exec.connectionPoolSizeTooltip: Specifies the maximum number of connections in the connection pool, maximum 10000.
xcan_exec.minIdleConnectionsTooltip: Specifies the minimum number of idle connections in the connection pool. The connection pool will maintain these idle connections for quick retrieval.
xcan_exec.enterIterationsOrDuration: Please enter iterations or execution duration
xcan_exec.mockDataTaskThreadRange: Mock data task thread support range: 1~1000
xcan_exec.experienceExecutionMaxDuration: Experience execution maximum execution duration 5 minutes

variable.updateVariableTooltip: When variable values have Mock data functions, after enabling, variable values are updated before each iteration, that is, variable values remain unchanged within the same iteration; when not enabled, variable values remain unchanged throughout the execution. Enabled by default.
variable.noVariablesReferenced: You have not referenced any variables yet,
variable.confirmUnreferenceVariable: Are you sure to unreference variable 「{name}」?
variable.confirmUnreferenceSelectedVariables: Are you sure to unreference the selected {num} variables?

xcan_execSettingForm.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this variable?
xcan_execSettingForm.rampUpTooltip1: Adjust thread startup interval, value cannot exceed execution duration.
xcan_execSettingForm.rampUpTooltip2: Adjust the number of threads gradually increased, value cannot exceed maximum threads.
xcan_execSettingForm.rampDownTooltip1: Adjust thread gradually decrease interval, value cannot exceed execution duration.
xcan_execSettingForm.rampDownTooltip2: Adjust the number of threads gradually decreased, value cannot exceed maximum threads.
xcan_execSettingForm.maxThreadsTooltip: Maximum thread count, will be evenly distributed across multiple nodes. Note: Mock data tasks support up to 1000 threads; functional tests only allow setting one thread.
xcan_execSettingForm.iterationsTooltip: Sampling iteration count, range 1~100000000000. Note: Functional tests default to 1 time, maximum limit 10 times.
xcan_execSettingForm.executionDurationTooltip: Execution duration, defaults to 30 seconds when neither iteration count nor duration is configured, maximum duration cannot exceed 1 day.
xcan_execSettingForm.resetSamplingResultsTooltip: Whether to clear previous sampling data and re-measure sampling after adjusting thread count.
xcan_execSettingForm.startupModeTooltip: Supports IMMEDIATELY (execute immediately) and TIMING (scheduled execution) two modes, default value IMMEDIATELY.
xcan_execSettingForm.scheduledExecutionTimeTooltip: Required when startup mode is 'Scheduled Execution', format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:MM:SS.
xcan_execSettingForm.priorityTooltip: Task priority, higher values have higher priority. Supported range: 1-2147483647, default value 1000.
xcan_execSettingForm.executionNodeCountTooltip: Number of nodes required for task execution, default value 1. Supported range: 1~200.
xcan_execSettingForm.availableExecutionNodesTooltip: Available execution node ID range, after setting, 'execution node count' nodes will be selected from this range. When no available execution node range is specified, 'execution node count' nodes will be selected from all nodes with 'execution' role.
xcan_execSettingForm.applicationNodesTooltip: Test application or middleware node ID. Used to provide data support for application or middleware performance evaluation, fault diagnosis, capacity planning and performance optimization.
xcan_execSettingForm.nodeSelectionStrategyTooltip: Whether to enable automatic node selection strategy, after enabling, the scheduler will select nodes that meet the following conditions to execute tasks, default not enabled.
xcan_execSettingForm.maxTaskCountTooltip: Maximum number of tasks allowed by execution nodes, ignored when exceeded, maximum 1000.
xcan_execSettingForm.lastExecutedNodeTooltip: Last executed node, select the node that last executed the current script, ignored on first execution.
xcan_execSettingForm.minimumSpecificationTooltip: Minimum CPU specification, maximum 64. Minimum memory specification, maximum 512GB. Minimum disk specification, maximum 2000GB.
xcan_execSettingForm.idleRateSelectionTooltip: Enable idle rate selection. Idle rate supports format: 80%, 80, 80.88%.
xcan_execSettingForm.idleRateTooltip: CPU idle rate, maximum 100%. Memory idle rate, maximum 100%. Disk idle rate, maximum 100%.
xcan_execSettingForm.errorHandlingMethodTooltip: Error handling method, supports CONTINUE (continue execution, default), STOP (stop) and STOP_NOW (stop immediately) three modes.
xcan_execSettingForm.sampleErrorContentTooltip: Whether to sample error content, enabling will send errors to the server, default enabled.
xcan_execSettingForm.samplingIntervalTooltip: Report sampling result interval, default 5 seconds. Supported range: 1~300 seconds.
xcan_execSettingForm.languageTooltip: Language displayed when outputting results and prompts, currently only supports zh_CN (Simplified Chinese) and en (English), default value zh_CN.
xcan_execSettingForm.startupRunnerTimeoutTooltip: Agent startup Runner program timeout, default 1 minute. Supported range: 1~7200 seconds.
xcan_execSettingForm.samplingInitializationTimeoutTooltip: Runner program initialization sampling timeout, default 1 minute. Supported range: 1~7200 seconds.
xcan_execSettingForm.stopExecutionTimeoutTooltip: Stop execution timeout, if sampling does not end within the specified timeout, execution will be forcibly killed, which may cause sampling errors, default 3 seconds. Supported range: 1~7200 seconds.
xcan_execSettingForm.ignoreAssertionsTooltip: Whether to ignore assertions, if not ignored, assertion failures will be handled as sampling errors.
xcan_execSettingForm.updateTestResultsTooltip: Whether to update test results to associated resources (API, test cases or scenarios).
xcan_execSettingForm.connectionTimeoutTimeTooltip: Specify the maximum waiting time for the client to establish a connection with the server, default 3 seconds.
xcan_execSettingForm.readTimeoutTooltip: Specify the time when the client does not receive a server response to close the connection, default 60 seconds.
xcan_execSettingForm.requestFailureRetryCountTooltip: Number of retries when request fails. No retry by default, maximum 6 times allowed.
xcan_execSettingForm.maxRedirectCountTooltip: Number of redirects when request returns 3xx status. Default 1 time, maximum 10 times allowed.
xcan_execSettingForm.responseTimeoutTooltip: Specify the maximum waiting time for the client to receive response messages, default 60 seconds.
xcan_execSettingForm.maxReconnectionsTooltip: Number of reconnections when connection is interrupted, default no reconnection, maximum 100 times.
xcan_execSettingForm.reconnectionIntervalTooltip: Request retry interval when request fails, default 200 milliseconds, maximum allowed time 30 minutes.
xcan_execSettingForm.databaseTypeTooltip: Supported database types: H2, HSQLDB, SQLITE, POSTGRES, MARIADB, MYSQL, ORACLE, SQLSERVER, DB2.
xcan_execSettingForm.driverClassNameTooltip: Database driver class name, such as: com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver.
xcan_execSettingForm.jdbcUrlTooltip: Database connection URL, such as: jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/mydatabase.
xcan_execSettingForm.transactionIsolationTooltip: Transaction isolation level: TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED (read uncommitted), TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED (read committed), TRANSACTION_REPEATABLE_READ (repeatable read), TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE (serializable).
xcan_execSettingForm.enableConfigurationTooltip: Whether to enable connection pool configuration
xcan_execSettingForm.connectionPoolTypeTooltip: Supported connection pools: hikari, tomcat, dbcp, dbcp2, c3p0, vibur, druid, druid_stat, druid_stat_merge.
xcan_execSettingForm.connectionPoolSizeTooltip: Specify the maximum number of connections in the connection pool, maximum 10000.
xcan_execSettingForm.minimumIdleConnectionsTooltip: Specify the minimum number of idle connections in the connection pool. The connection pool will maintain these idle connections for quick access.
xcan_execSettingForm.startAtDateRule: Please enter the scheduled execution time
xcan_execSettingForm.databaseDriverClassNamePlaceholder: Please enter database driver class name
xcan_execSettingForm.databaseDriverClassNameTooltip: Database driver class name, such as: com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver.
xcan_execSettingForm.enterDurationOrIterations: Please enter execution duration or iterations

xcan_functionModal.enterFunctionInstance: Enter function instance, such as @Name() or Hello@Name()

xcan_indicator.enableTestTooltip: When enabled, the test will be marked as a mandatory activity and the test results will be included in the performance analysis.
xcan_indicator.smokeTestDescription: Used by developers or testers to quickly verify that the basic functionality of the interface is available.
xcan_indicator.securityTestDescription: Used to prevent unauthorized or illegal access, such as sending requests with valid authentication tokens to ensure that responses do not return 401 invalid authorization or 403 insufficient permissions.
xcan_indicator.performanceTestDescription: Evaluate the performance and response speed of software systems under different concurrent user conditions in specific environments, help developers optimize performance, and support operations personnel in making accurate scaling decisions.
xcan_indicator.performanceTestDefault: Default performance test plan: Start with 100 users, increase by 100 users every 1 minute, continue for 50 minutes, observe performance and response performance during the test process, and verify that there are concurrent numbers or concurrent intervals where 'transactions per second greater than or equal to 500, 90% (P90) of requests have an average response time (latency) less than 500 milliseconds, error rate not exceeding 0.01%, and all resource usage not exceeding 75%'.
xcan_indicator.stabilityTestDescription: Evaluate the stability and reliability of software systems under long-term operation and load conditions to determine the stability level of the system in real production environments.
xcan_indicator.stabilityTestDefault: Default stability test plan: 200 users for 30 minutes, transactions per second must be greater than or equal to 500, 90% (P90) of requests have an average response time (latency) not greater than 500 milliseconds, error rate not exceeding 0.01%, and all resource usage not exceeding 75%.
xcan_indicator.functionalTestDescription: Simulate different usage scenarios to verify that the interface works as expected, thereby ensuring the correctness and reliability of the interface. Use interface test cases to quickly test new features or modified features, ensure that new code does not affect existing functionality, ensure that various components or services in the software system can interact correctly, and support rapid iteration and continuous integration.
xcan_indicator.concurrencyMustBeGreaterThanZero: Concurrency must be greater than zero
xcan_indicator.testDurationMustBeGreaterThanZero: Test duration must be greater than zero
xcan_indicator.responseTimeMustBeGreaterThanZero: Response time must be greater than zero
xcan_indicator.throughputMustBeGreaterThanZero: Throughput must be greater than zero
xcan_indicator.errorRateShouldBeLessThan100: Error rate should be less than 100%
xcan_indicator.errorRateMustBeLessThan100: Error rate must be less than 100%
xcan_indicator.cpuUsageMustBeLessThan100: CPU usage must be less than 100%
xcan_indicator.memoryUsageMustBeLessThan100: Memory usage must be less than 100%
xcan_indicator.diskUsageMustBeLessThan100: Disk usage must be less than 100%
xcan_indicator.networkUsageMustBeLessThan100: Network usage must be less than 100%

xcan_multipleUpload.fileSizeLimitExceeded: File size limit exceeded {maxSize}, {fileName} size is {fileSize}.

xcan_responseAssert.isEmpty: Is Empty (empty string or null value)
xcan_responseAssert.notEmpty: Not Empty (non-empty string or non-null value)

xcan_singleUpload.fileSizeLimitExceeded: File size limit is {maxSize}, current pasted content size is {currentSize}.
xcan_singleUpload.fileSizeLimitExceededWithName: File size limit is {maxSize}, {fileName} size is {fileSize}.
xcan_singleUpload.defaultTipText: In this area, you can upload by pasting content or directly dragging files, but please note that the uploaded file size should not exceed {maxSize}.

xcan_variable.variableDescription: By defining variables, you can reuse a parameter value or control condition execution. For example: variables defined in request parameters can be referenced in current request response assertions or used as part of execution condition expressions.
xcan_variable.variablePriority: Variable priority with the same name: API variable > Service variable > Project variable > Current defined global variable > Other global variables.
xcan_variable.projectVariableDescription: Define variables that are only allowed to be used by all interfaces under the current project.
xcan_variable.serviceVariableDescription: Define variables that are only allowed to be used by interfaces under the current service.
xcan_variable.apiVariableDescription: Define variables that are only allowed to be used by the current interface.
xcan_variable.inheritedVariableDescription: Variables inherited from parent services and projects have lower priority than current interface variables but higher priority than global variables.
xcan_variable.globalVariableDescription: Global variables are effective for all interfaces of the tenant. When global variables have the same name as interface/service/project variables, they have the lowest priority.
xcan_variable.extractTooltip: Defining extraction variables for interfaces does not support dependency on other variables.
xcan_variable.dataNotSaved: Data not saved, please save data first or cancel editing
xcan_variable.sameInterfaceVariableNameNotAllowed: Variable names are not allowed to be duplicated under the same interface.
xcan_variable.sameProjectVariableNameNotAllowed: Variable names are not allowed to be duplicated under the same project.
xcan_variable.sameServiceVariableNameNotAllowed: Variable names are not allowed to be duplicated under the same service.
xcan_variable.globalVariableNameNotAllowed: Global variable names are not allowed to be duplicated.
xcan_variable.currentScopeDescription: When variable scope is 'current', it is effective for all interfaces in the current interface request or current 'execution/script'.
xcan_variable.globalScopeDescription: When variable scope is 'global', it is effective for all interfaces of the tenant.
xcan_variable.extractVariableNotSupportDependency: Defining extraction variables for interfaces does not support dependency on other variables.

xcan_assertionsResult.noVariableDefined: No {variableName} variable defined, directly execute this condition expression
xcan_assertionsResult.expressionEmpty: Expression is empty, execute this assertion
xcan_assertionsResult.conditionNotMet: Operation result is not met, ignore this assertion
xcan_assertionsResult.conditionMet: Operation result is met, execute this assertion
xcan_assertionsResult.isEmpty: Is Empty (empty string or null value)
xcan_assertionsResult.notEmpty: Not Empty (non-empty string or non-null value)

xcan_httpTestDetail.ignoreAssertionMessage: You have enabled ignore assertions, assertions will not be executed this time. If you need to enable assertions, please close the ignore assertion option in

xcan_execDetailLog.noAgentAccessInfo: No agent access information, connection failed address:

xcan_execScriptInfo.pleaseEnterScriptNamePlaceholder: Please enter script name, maximum 200 characters
xcan_execScriptInfo.pleaseEnterDescriptionPlaceholder: Please enter script description, maximum 800 characters

xcan_scenarioDebugResult.ignoreAssertionsMessage: You have enabled ignore assertions, assertions will not be executed this time. If you need to enable assertions, please go to
xcan_scenarioDebugResult.closeIgnoreAssertions: to close the ignore assertions option.
